availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Daniel Guy (Louisville, Kentucky, molder and grocer)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, molder and grocer. Native of Ireland. Son of Daniel Guy and Elizabeth Guy. Married to Catherine Mullen Guy in Jefferson County, Kentucky, on January 8, 1864. Father of James J. Guy. Iron molder in Louisville in 1850. Farmer in Jefferson County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Jefferson County in 1860. Road overseer in Jefferson County in 1864. Grocer in Louisville in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, District 7, p. 342B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 1, p. 850.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, District 1, p. 226B.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Missouri, St. Louis, District 29, p. 504A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Jefferson County Marriages, Film 000482709.
"Jefferson County Court," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), March 15, 1864, p. 3.
Edwards' Annual Director to the Inhabitants, Institutions, Incorporated Companies, Manufacturing Establishments, Business firms, Etc., Etc., in the City of Louisville, For 1865-6 (Louisville: Edwards, Greenough & Deved, 1866), 331.
